What is the swimmer's skill level?

Pick the option that best fits the swimmer's goals.

wizardAnswers.label: Competitive Team
wizardAnswers.description: With a focus on lively competition, these highly regarded year-round program provide a team atmosphere to foster opportunity and stick to goals.

wizardAnswers.label: Marlin
wizardAnswers.description: “FUN”damentals – To teach SwimMAC athletes entering the sport of competitive swimming a great foundation of skill development & technique in a style that can be fun & fruitful for long-term growth in the sport of swimming.

wizardAnswers.label: Dolphin
wizardAnswers.description: Learn to Practice” – SwimMAC athletes will progress from the fundamental skills & technique taught in the Marlin Division and continue to build toward an advanced level of learning.

wizardAnswers.label: Shark
wizardAnswers.description: "Practice to Compete" – Athletes are taught progressive skills & drills in a variety of ways to prepare them for the present and senior level. They will learn race strategies and build upon practice habits & skill development.

wizardAnswers.label: Senior
wizardAnswers.description: "Compete to Excel" – SwimMAC athletes continue to progress as well as take ownership to put it all together for the purpose of excelling toward their career goals.

wizardAnswers.label: MiniMAC North
wizardAnswers.description: Skills include: blowing bubbles, breath holding, kicking feet, rowing arms, reaching for wall & 'crawling' along wall. Goal is to have parents out of the water by last class of most advanced session.

wizardAnswers.label: MiniMAC South
wizardAnswers.description: Skills include: blowing bubbles, breath holding, kicking feet, rowing arms, reaching for wall & 'crawling' along wall. Goal is to have parents out of the water by last class of most advanced session.

wizardAnswers.label: PreSchool North
wizardAnswers.description: Here the budding swimmer will work toward moving up from parent & child to child only. They'll build a foundation, learn new skills, and continue to develop confidence in the water.

wizardAnswers.label: PreSchool South
wizardAnswers.description: Here the budding swimmer will work toward moving up from parent & child to child only. They'll build a foundation, learn new skills, and continue to develop confidence in the water.

wizardAnswers.label: Grade School North
wizardAnswers.description: These classes help children and preteens work toward building a foundation, learning new skills, and continuing to develop confidence in the water.

wizardAnswers.label: Grade School South
wizardAnswers.description: These classes help children and preteens work toward building a foundation, learning new skills, and continuing to develop confidence in the water.

wizardAnswers.label: Swim School
wizardAnswers.description: SwimMAC Swim School offers a variety of programs for students of all ages and levels of experience. Classes include MiniMAC, Preschool, Grade school, Adult and Private Lessons. In a small group or individual setting, SwimMAC Swim School instructors focus on fun methods to teach safety and proper technique. Our skill progression structure sets students up for success, and establishes a strong foundation while instilling a love of swimming in a positive and supportive environment.

wizardAnswers.label: Homeschool
wizardAnswers.description: Structured with homeschool families in mind, we offer three different levels for ages 3–18 years taught simultaneously in the same pool during the school day. Convenient for families of multiple swimmers! Fulfills PE requirements.

wizardAnswers.label: Masters
wizardAnswers.description: The SwimMAC Masters & Adult Fitness program welcomes people of any ability level. We have four basic categories of Masters swimmers: Adult-Learn-to Swim Program (ALTS) participants, Competitive Swimmers (Open Water & Swim Meets), Triathlon Swimmers, and Fitness Swimmers.

wizardAnswers.label: Private Lessons
wizardAnswers.description: Private lessons cater to a swimmer's specific objectives with a customized training plan created by one of our qualified private lesson instructors.

wizardAnswers.label: Adult Lessons
wizardAnswers.description: This is a beginner group lesson for adults 18 and over. Lessons will range from learning the basics of blowing bubbles and ﬂoating, to recreational swimming for fitness.

wizardAnswers.label: JSL
wizardAnswers.description: A technique-based program for all four strokes. Increase strength and endurance through drills and kicking. Provides an intro to racing skills such as dives and turns. Get a good workout in a close team setting. Tryouts required.

wizardAnswers.label: Teen Fit
wizardAnswers.description: Intended for teens and preteens looking for a great aerobic and skill base program that creates a nurturing competitive environment. A great way to stay active and get stronger! Prepare for a swim team, improve technique, or cross train for other sports.

wizardAnswers.label: Teen Lessons
wizardAnswers.description: Intended for teens and preteens looking for a great aerobic and skill base program that creates a nurturing competitive environment. A great way to stay active and get stronger! Prepare for a swim team, improve technique, or cross train for other sports.
